Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly of type A; interior, from outside: part of wide black band; three narrow bands framing tondo; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of deer (head with antler and part of neck with added red remaining) to left; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 21)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 445, no. B733)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1434) (phase 3)
